summary: Lemon juice, rind, and peel are used in a wide variety of foods and drinks. . The preserved lemon is used in a wide variety of dishes. . The Lisbon lemon is very similar to the Eureka and is the other common supermarket lemon. . The distinctive sour taste of lemon juice, derived from the citric acid, makes it a key ingredient in drinks and foods such as lemonade and lemon meringue pie. . The leaves of the lemon tree are used to make a tea and for preparing cooked meats and seafoods.
